hungerGames.author: suzanneCollins
hungerGames.food: spreads the bread slices with the
hungerGames.topping: soft goat cheese, carefully placing a basil leaf on each while I strip the bushes of their berries.
hungerGames.place: We settle back in a nook in the rocks. From this place, we are invisible but have a clear view of the valley, which is teeming with summer life,
hungerGames.gathering: greens to gather, roots to dig, fish iridescent in the sunlight. The day is glorious, with a blue sky and soft breeze.
hungerGames.meal: The food’s wonderful, with the cheese seeping into the warm bread and the berries bursting in our mouths.
hungerGames.situation: Everything would be perfect if this really was a holiday, if all the day off meant was roaming the mountains with Gale, hunting for tonight’s supper. But instead we have to be standing in the square at two o’clock waiting for the names to be called out.
